results.description:
***This meetup is restricted to people who have attended at least one discussion of the Knapsack meetup group in the last six months. (Most of our meetups count.)***

Each session includes time to: connect with each other, silently reflect and write about our anti-racism work, report on how we're doing regarding our anti-racism work, and receive input and feedback.  We usually do the reporting and input/feedback in small groups of 3-4 people.  If you can't stay as late as 4:30, please go ahead and RSVP, just let us know your limitations.

Remember to bring your notebook, if you have one!  (We'll have a few extra for anyone who hasn't come to an accountability/support session before.) Also, feel free to bring any writings or objects you want to share as part of your anti-racism thinking and work.

We have two options for the accountability/support session each month, hoping that those who want to join us will be able to go to one or the other.  You are welcome to attend both sessions, if you would like to do so. 


For more about our thoughts on these sessions, see "Open discussion to consider monthly accountability sessions."  Note: even if you don't claim to be doing anti-racism work, you can come to the session and see what it is about, as well as consider your own role. You still need to have met the requirement of having attended one of our discussion meetups within the last six months.


This is also a place where you can learn about and find an accountabilibuddy. 

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.name: November Accountability and Support Session, Option 2 of 2

results.description:
"The Chronic Single's Handbook" is a one-hour, one-man show about a never-married hypochondriac who takes a trip around the world hoping to change his luck with love. It's an unflinching look at how men feel about sex, love, marriage, and massage parlors. The show has been featured at theater festivals in the U.S., Canada, and Edinburgh, Scotland. What Critics Are Saying:

"A lot of fun to watch." Four Stars (Winnipeg Free Press) "Literary" "Funny" "Raw" (DCMetroTheaterArts) "Sharply funny…a quality solo show" (FringeReview, Edinburgh)

For more info and to get the cheap tickets go to http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2245816?discount=chronic&show_widget=1&date=1320881 and make sure to select the correct date in the upper left corner as: "Sun Nov 22, 2015..."

results.description:
My house is almost at the fork where Franklin Street joins Nahant Street. It's a blue duplex with a porch in the front and the American flag hanging over it. Please keep in mind that I share my driveway with my neighbor, so parking in the driveway is limited. I'll put my car in the garage, and my husband plans to make himself scarce for "my" Sunday afternoons, so there should be a couple of parking spaces in the driveway; but please park as far to the side as you can, so my neighbor can get in and out. There is parking on one side of my street, and on the surrounding streets, so you should not have any problems finding a spot. I have scheduled several meetings automatically, every two weeks, on Sundays, 3 to 5 pm. If I have to cancel a meet up for any reason (family matters and such), I will let everyone know at least a few days in advance.

I am very happy to have such a large, and growing, group, and I look forward very much to meeting everyone.

SEE YOU ALL ON SUNDAY, JUNE 07, at 3 PM!

results.description:
Let's do this.

I've noticed there's a big crossover between the knitting community and the board gaming community, this is my effort to get these two sets of people together. You'll get along, trust me ;-)


Also, I have been involved teaching and such at the new CRAFTWORK SOMERVILLE, and I asked the owner if she'd be up for me trying a Nerd Fun Knitting and Games and she said "sure".

The $5 is going towards the space rental, and Aram and I will bring our board games, candy, and cheese.

Bring KNITTING and/or GAMES you'd like to play.

If you don't knit, don't worry, we won't make you. :-D This is just about like minded souls getting together.

Bring beverages if you'd like to drink something: soda, cider, wine, beer.

I am also listing this on "the nerd fun mobile knitting group", so we will have 12-14 people attending.

Games we will likely bring: New Salem, Coloretto, Ticket to Ride, etc.

results.description:
The oldest, established, permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and environs.

Please join the Fresh Pond Community walkers + five other meetup groups for this delightful sunset walk. 

Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 3 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 11/22 3:30

results.description:
Join The Oldest Established Permanent Floating Community Walk in Cambridge 

For the 200th consecutive Sunday, we will be walking.   Let's join 20 or so others from other walking groups for this walk.

The walk is on, rain or shine.


Since May 2012, there has been a regular walk around Fresh Pond at about an hour before sunset. Frequently, 20-25 walkers turn out for this walk, and you can too. There are a whole bunch of regulars, along with some new people.


Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

We'll all go out for dinner afterwards, somewhere in the neighborhood.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 11/22 3:30

venue.name: Panera Bread - Downstairs

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Panera Bread in Porter Square Shopping Center

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Panera Bread is right next to Dunkin Donuts. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean and Arthur
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 39-49 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

This is a FREE event open to all. As we have welcomed so many new souls to the group over the past year, we would like to offer our healing studio, the sacred space we have all created, open to come together to connect, meet new like-minded souls, to create a bigger community and to learn more about what Elaine and Nicol offer at Essence of Healing.

Elaine will be offering mini angel card readings and Nicol will offer mini hands on healing or energy clearing sessions. We will begin with an opening and blessing at 5:15pm which everyone is invited to join and we will also close with a guided meditation and blessing at 6:30pm. Light refreshments will be shared, and if you would like to contribute something we would be blessed! Learn more about us on our website www.essencehealing.net and contact us anytime.

SIMPLY THE HOTTEST SOCIAL IN BOSTON SPINNING VINYL.

As always, there will also be percussion instruments available for those that know how to play them! Timbales, Congas, Bongos, Maracas, Guiro, etc. This will trully be a Jam Session!

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

SIMPLY THE HOTTEST SOCIAL IN BOSTON SPINNING VINYL.

results.description:
$10 admission


Note: All are welcome to join the musicians across the street for dinner at the S&S Deli & Restaurant

Pianist/composer Erik Lindgren will be in concert with his lively quartet consisting of members of the Brockton Symphony Orchestra. The ensemble will present an invigorating evening of crossover chamber music sans boundaries including quirky Musical Novelties, impressionistic tone poems, original tangos, neo-Baroque escapades, plus rollicking arrangements of Leroy Anderson and Raymond Scott chestnuts. A pleasant and uplifting time is guaranteed for all!

Thomasine Berg-flute


Torben Hansen-clarinet


Mark Finklestein-bassoon


Erik Lindgren-piano

Thomasine Berg was principal flutist in the conductor’s symposium orchestra at the Vienna Conservatory, and has been a member of the Flint (Michigan) Symphony Orchestra, the Opera Festival Orchestra of Las Palmas, Canary Islands, and the Blue Hills Chamber Players in the Boston area. Most recently, she served as editor of classical music and visual arts for the Boston Globe while continuing to perform as a freelance chamber musician and soloist.

Torben Hansen has studied at the Cleveland Institute of Music, Mount Union College, the Mozarteum in Salzburg, Austria, and the New England Conservatory of Music. He has soloed with the Chamber Orchestra of Cape Ann,  the Tri-Town Symphony Orchestra and the Metropolitan Wind Symphony. Mr. Hansen is principal clarinet with the Brockton Symphony and Quincy Symphony Orchestras, and the chair of the BrSO.

Mark Finklestein is a physician by day and musician by night. He is the principal oboist for the Brockton Symphony Orchestra and the principal bassoonist for the Sharon Community Chamber Orchestra.. He has 20 years of professional musical experience and also performs in chamber groups and recitals on clarinet, oboe, English horn, and bassoon.

Erik Lindgren has a catalog of over six dozen works, ranging from solo piano pieces to chamber music to orchestral works. In 2012, the Georgia Symphony Orchestra commissioned Lindgren to write "Extreme Spirituals," a 25-minute work for orchestra and bass baritone soloist which was premiered in Atlanta. “Erik Lindgren scores consummate musicianship from the spatially abstract to a defining American vernacular. Erik Lindgren IS American music.” — Van Dyke Parks

results.description:
Christopher John Francis Boone knows all the countries of the world and their capitals and every prime number up to 7,057. He relates well to animals but has no understanding of human emotions. He cannot stand to be touched. And he detests the color yellow.

Although gifted with a superbly logical brain, for fifteen-year-old Christopher everyday interactions and admonishments have little meaning. He lives on patterns, rules, and a diagram kept in his pocket. Then one day, a neighbor's dog, Wellington, is killed and his carefully constructive universe is threatened. Christopher sets out to solve the murder in the style of his favourite (logical) detective, Sherlock Holmes. What follows makes for a novel that is funny, poignant and fascinating in its portrayal of a person whose curse and blessing are a mind that perceives the world entirely literally.

results.description:
Do you know a teenager ... who could benefit from developing a more clear sense of purpose and direction for their life?  

If so, come to this meeting to learn about the Insight Teen Seminar where they can develop that part in themselves that will guide them, where they can safely share the fears and their hopes, be acknowledged for who they are, and look deeply at what they really want in their life.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=62uX84HZ6wI

The Insight Teen Seminar takes place Thur-Sun, Feb 18-21, 2016.  
- - > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/events/221875651/

On Sunday, Nov 22nd we'll provide information, answer your questions, and give you a taste of some the processes in the seminar itself.

http://www.insightseminars.org/uploads/6/0/0/1/60013961/4380606.jpg?432

A Little Bit about the Teen Insight I

It brings together teenagers from diverse backgrounds and helps them to consciously choose creating the life they truly want.

Close connections are often made in the Teen Insight I seminar, and compassionate leadership is beautifully demonstrated by these teens as the seminar progresses.

For more information about the upcoming Insight I for Teens:
- - > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/events/221875651/

For an experience of what the Insight I for Teens could mean for the teenager you know, come to this night!
results.name: Insight: Do You Know a Teenager?

RSVPs are NOT correct. This event is posted with 10 other Groups. Cost: $10.  Skate rental are available.

Host: Steve Ob1. [masked] [masked]
Please join Steve Ob1. and friends for an evening of exercising, socializing and music. This is an indoor adult setting, no kids. This is a great place to learn, or improve your skating skills. Steve Ob1.is an instructor, and if asked, he will be happy to offer you some free help to get you started. Come and see skating in an all new way. The skaters at this rink are some of the best free dancer skaters, speed skaters and roller derby in N.E.. Steve carpools from Nashua at 7 pm. on down. The doors of the rink open at 8 pm. to midnight. But Steve Ob1 will not be there til around 8:30.  Also, this is Steve Ob1.'s work out. So after he burns himself out. results.description:
Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth.  Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity."  If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker!  It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up.  Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

Agenda:

8:00 p.m. - 8:30 p.m. - Participants Arrive & Register (If at the door, tickets are available).

8:30 p.m. - 10:00 p.m. - "Cards Against Humanity" begins.

10:00 p.m. - TBD - Raffle Prizes and closing remarks.

Price:

- All tickets include your first drink

- $25 at the door (if tickets available)

- $17 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

Early bird special: 

First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $12 instead of $17).

Pre-pay by CLICKING HERE

* Once all 25 male/ 25 female tickets have been sold, we will release more tickets in increments. We are able to hold a maximum of 60 singles (30 males / 30 females)!

Recommended Attire:

Men - Come presentable; highly recommend collared shirt with jeans or slacks.

Women - Come casual but classy; do not have to come in a dress but blouses recommended over shirts.

results.description:
It's week 9 of the 2015 Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing. Last week we had over 100 people show up to the show and we couldn't be more thrilled! Thanks to everyone's ongoing support, we couldn't pull this off without you. If you want to guarantee a seat for this weeks show make sure you RSVP on Eventbrite!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/liquid-courage-comedy-club-112215-tickets-19625365998

Zach Sherwin is a rapper, comedian, writer, and actor. His television credits include appearances on “Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell” (FX, FXX) and “The Pete Holmes Show” (TBS), and his music videos have been viewed millions of times online. Zach performs frequently in the blockbuster YouTube series “Epic Rap Battles of History,” and in 2014, the RIAA awarded him a gold record for the “Albert Einstein vs. Stephen Hawking” single. He is also a Streamy Award-winning staff writer for the series, and his other writing credits include the MTV Movie Awards and “Crazy Ex-Girlfriend” (CW). His albums are available on Comedy Central Records and A Special Thing Records. Born in Ohio and raised in Missouri, Zach began performing comedy in Boston before moving to Los Angeles, where he currently resides. Go down the rabbit hole at youtube.com/zachsherwin,twitter.com/zachsherwin, and instagram.com/zachsherwin.


FREE: The comedy club experience is called the Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing Company. The brewery and destination-taproom, which opened in April of 2105, opens Sunday nights as a showcase style stand-up comedy club open to the public 21+ with no cover charge or ticket fee. Guests are able to order charcuterie boards, dinner and pints during, before and after the show. With a Sunday night show time of 9PM there is ample free parking is available.

Season 1, the 2015 dates are as follows: September 13th, 20th and 27th, October 4th, 11th and 25th, November 1st 8th 15th and 22nd December 6th 13th 20th and 27th.

The opening night on September 6th filled to capacity and guests were entertained by 7 professional comedians and show host C.J. Browne. “We’re excited to offer a curated show of experienced local comedians. Since the room and setup require excellence the showcase is not an open mic night. We are absolutely psyched about the success of opening night. We played to a full house that loved the show.” Show performer Gary Peterson says “The Slumbrew comedy show was such a fun room to work, because the owners care about making it fun. A packed house of young heroes supporting the local scene makes this place special. It makes me happy to know something so cool is alive in Somerville.”
results.name: Liquid Courage Presents Zach Sherwin

results.description:
Weather permitting!

We'll meet at the Park across from 181 Market Street in historic downtown Lowell and head off.  We'll walk for about an hour.


Weather guidelines - about 20 degrees is the coldest I will tolerate.  I don't mind light precipitation, but you won't find me out if it's really coming down.

If I can't make it or I'm not going to walk, I will try my best to change my RSVP.  We have some regulars now, so feel free to show up and walk with them.  Hope to see you around downtown Lowell in the early weekday mornings!

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
BVS Vegan Thanksgiving at Red Lentil

* 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM Nov 23, 2015 - Monday
* 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM Nov 24, 2015 - Tuesday


The fabulous annual BVS Vegan Thanksgiving Dinner!


RSVP required THROUGH BVS at this site.

Details, menu, and sign up are here.

We hope that you can join us for a great meal and a good time!

NO ONE GETS IN WITHOUT RESERVING WITH BVS.

Red Lentil has created an exquisite menu at a bargain price for BVS! 

Five courses, two items per course, plus vegetable sides and beverage all for just $25 (+tax+service.) 

Self-served buffet style so you can taste everything and go back for seconds on what you like best. 

The meal will be brimming with whole, unprocessed plant foods that combine beautiful colors, textures, and flavors, and bursts with nutritious, health-promoting ingredients. 

Red Lentil will offer their own Vegan Thanksgiving Dinner with a different menu on Thanksgiving Day

MONDAY & TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 23 & 24, 2015
4:30 - 9:30 PM - Open seating - Sign-up required 

We will be seated at friendly group tables, so never hesitate to arrive alone to a BVS event! 

If you are able to arrive at 4:30 PM or after 8:30, please do. 

Peak time tends to be 6:30 - 8:00. 

Parties of 5 or more, or those with small children, are recommended to arrive at 4:30 if possible. 

PRICE: $25 includes five-courses (both options for each) and beverage. 
Tax and tip are extra. 
Please be generous to the wait staff as they work very hard for our event! 

Children's prices: Up to 5 years FREE; 
6-13 years 1/2 price ($12.50 + tax+service); 
14-adult $25 (+tax+service) 

Vegan and organic wines are available as an extra. 

Please be mindful of food waste. Buffets are wonderful for tasting many items and getting seconds, but "the eye is bigger than the stomach" comes into play and can result in food waste. 

Please take only what you can eat.
results.name: BVS Vegan Thanksgiving Dinner at Red Lentil

results.description:
New:

Due to time constraints and the game being very adjustable to new players joining and leaving at any time, I am making a change.

I do wish people to get something to compensate IHOP for letting us use the space, however, if you have not started or finished eating by 7:15pm please, start or finish eating at another table. The rest of the people will clean the table and start playing.  I want the rest of the players to have a chance to finish a game.


The rules give new players the opportunity to join the game at the start of any new hand, with the score of the mean player.

I am trying to keep the game and conversation balanced for everyone.  If multiple players are eating, conversing and playing,  the game may be held up until some people are restless.

Also, the more people eating and playing while handling the cards, the greater chance the few decks of "Jumbo Index" cards used for Negation Hearts will be marked and hard to shuffle, detracting from the game.

As always, please put your cold drinks on a napkin.

Thank you;

Negation Hearts Night. New players are VERY welcome: We will teach you how to play.

It is suggested that you get a drink or something else there, to compensate the hosting establishment. .

PUBLIC:

Both: The 450 and 456 Buses have nearby stops. 

Negation Hearts is played with two decks of cards. Two of the same cards like two king of clubs negate and the next highest card of the suit lead takes the cards played. So, even playing a two has not been safe at times. The scoring and passing are slightly altered from "Cancellation" hearts so that new people can join in or leave at the start of any hand.

The 50 cent charge is totally voluntary and is only to approximately cover the meetup charge.

This is SOCIAL CARDS conversation is encouraged, however please be aware of when it is your turn to play a card, we try to keep the fun balanced between the two.
results.name: Negation Hearts in Salem @ IHOP *

results.description:
(Please note our new RSVP policy below.) 


We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.  Games often last 90 minutes or more and involve juggling a lot of rules and factors in your head, to decide what to do.  However, there's also plenty of laughter and friendship involved.  If that sounds up your alley, we hope you'll join us.

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.  If you expect to arrive later than 8:30, send Tucker a message earlier in the day, and we'll make sure someone is there to let you in.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm onwards.  Our group has been running since 2007, and we have a large crowd of regulars as well as new members each week.


BEANTOWN GAMERS RSVP POLICY:


1. Due to finite space, you must RSVP to attend.

2. Please be considerate of others -- only RSVP if you are likely to attend.

3. If you need to cancel your RSVP, please do so at least 24 hours before the event.  This allows enough notice for someone else to use your spot.

4. If you would like to come but there are no spots, consider attending our alternative "Light Game Night" a few steps away at Cosi Cafe.  You can also sign up as "wants a spot" and receive emails from meetup if a spot opens up.  Finally, if there are unusual circumstances, you can send Tucker a message.

5. We know everyone has emergencies.  But consistent, inconsiderate use of RSVPs -- which includes being a "no show", cancelling in the last 24 hours, or constantly cancelling RSVPs -- will lead to being removed from the group.  Sorry, we still like you, it's just not fair to everyone else!

6. If you use a "+1" spot, you are responsible for all of the above for your +1.  Since you are using two spots, it is extra important that you are considerate about it.

NEW MEMBERS: Welcome!  We look forward to meeting you.  If you want to bring a friend, please have them sign up with their own account rather than using a +1.  Unfortunately, we've gotten a lot of no-show +1's from first time attendees, so we don't accept those anymore.  Sorry!

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle


As you can see, there is some real variety.  A few of our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan, Carcassonne, and Ticket to Ride.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

Update (10/15): In order to accommodate more people in the room, and maintain an easygoing environment for conversation and game playing, we ask that you please save loud games (like those with real-time arguing) for later in the evening, when the room is less full.  Typically this means 9:30 or later.


OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right. There is a suggested donation of $1.00 that goes towards site fees and party supplies.  (When we have a raffle, you will also receive an extra raffle ticket as thanks for donating.)

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.

results.description:
Science and Cooking - A semester-long public lecture series that pairs Harvard University professors with popular chefs and food experts to showcase the science behind different cooking techniques. This lecture series is sponsored by the Harvard University John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences. 

Full schedule below and HERE. Free and open to the public. 

:: :: ::

Lecture 10) Monday, Nov. 23 - Title TBA - Nathan Myhrvold, (@ModernCuisine), former Chief Technology Officer of Microsoft, co-founder of Intellectual Ventures, author of “Modernist Cuisine”

:: :: ::


These public lectures are based on the Harvard course “Science and Cooking: From Haute Cuisine to the Science of Soft Matter,” but do not replicate course content. Unless otherwise noted, all talks take place in the Harvard Science Center (1 Oxford St., Cambridge, Hall C) and begin at 7 p.m. Each presentation begins with a 15-minute lecture by a faculty member from the Harvard course, who will discuss one of the scientific topics from that week’s class. Seating for all lectures is first come, first seated. If you have questions regarding this public lecture series, please contact [masked]. 

:: :: ::

Sample Lecture: Explorations of Chocolate Textures [Lecture 4 (2012)]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tt9g2se1LcM&index=10&list=PL546CD09EA2399DAB

:: :: ::

Full schedule

Lecture 1) Monday, Sept. 7 - Thinking about Flavor - Dave Arnold (@CookingIssues), Booker & Dax, and host of “Cooking Issues” and Harold McGee (@Harold_McGee), writer, “Curious Cook”


Lecture 2) Monday, Sept. 14 - Pasta Magic - Mark Ladner, (@ChefMarkLadner), Del Posto

Lecture 3) Monday, Sept. 21 - The Science of Sugar - Joanne Chang ’91, (@jbchang), Flour Bakery, author of “Flour” and “Flour Too”

Lecture 4) Monday, Sept. 28 - Title TBA* - *Jim Lahey, (@jimlaheySSB), Sullivan Street Bakery

Lecture 5) Monday, Oct. 12 - Science and Emotions: Delicious or Disgusting? - Andoni Aduriz, (@mugaritz), Mugaritz and Ramon Perisé, Mugaritz

Lecture 6) Monday, Oct. 19 - Heat Transfer to Capture Flavors - Josep Roca, (@CanRocaCeller), El Celler de Can Roca and Raül Sillero, El Celler de Can Roca

Lecture 7) <Location TBA> Tuesday, Oct. 27 - Viscosity and Polymers - José Andrés, (@chefjoseandres), ThinkFoodGroup

Lecture 8) Monday, Nov. 2 - Title TBA - Bryan Voltaggio, (@BryanVoltaggio), Volt*Michael Voltaggio, (@MVoltaggio), Ink

Lecture 9) Monday, Nov. 16 - Fermentation on Wheels: Food Education and Community Impact - Tara Whitsitt, (@tarawhitsitt), Fermentation on Wheels

Lecture 10) Monday, Nov. 23 - Title TBA - Nathan Myhrvold, (@ModernCuisine), former Chief Technology Officer of Microsoft, co-founder of Intellectual Ventures, author of “Modernist Cuisine”

Lecture 11) Monday, Dec. 7 - Title TBA - Tom Colicchio, (@tomcolicchio), “Top Chef” judge and chef/owner, Craft Hospitality, and Mei Lin, (@meilin21), “Top Chef” season 12 winner, and Gail Simmons, (@gailsimmons), “Top Chef” judge, Culinary expert, and Food & Wine magazine Special Projects Director

:: :: ::

The Harvard College Course: The Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS) and the Alícia Foundation developed a General Education science course, “Science and Cooking: From Haute Cuisine to the Science of Soft Matter,” which debuted in the fall of 2010. The course uses food and cooking to explicate fundamental principles in applied physics and engineering. (Watch a video about the course.) Limited to currently enrolled Harvard undergraduates, the class brings together eminent Harvard researchers and world-class chefs. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p3v8eFwDWnk&feature=youtu.be

:: :: ::

A version of “Science and Cooking” is offered for credit through the Harvard Extension School. An online course will be offered in the fall and spring semesters. Registered students will have access to the expertise and support of Harvard teaching staff.

:: :: ::

For more info visit <a>www.seas.harvard.edu.</a>

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the Event Host(s) (see RSVP list), from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from cubbies, if available).
results.name: MetroRock Monday

results.description:
Join members of Social Fun as we brainstorm event ideas and start planning some fun events for the Fall, Winter, Spring and Summer!  Members of the South Shore Organizer Team invite EVERYONE interested in attending or hosting events on the South Shore!  This is one of the best ways to help ensure an event you want to enjoy makes its way onto the calendar. 


We'll work together to come up with a list of events then we'll vote on them. From there we'll determine 4-8 events to plan both in the short and long term.  If anyone is interested in co-hosting a specific event with an Organizer this will be a great way to get it planned and on everyone's calendars.

We'll keep this event to one hour so everyone can get home to watch the Pats play @ 8:30pm (or Dancing with the Stars @ 8pm!).  We have the room from 6:45-8:15 for set-up and clean-up or anyone who wants to linger to plan or chat.  This is a short workweek so hopefully you can join us for an hour to help plan some events on the South Shore!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


South Shore Event Planning!

Monday, November 23rd @ 7-8pm

Thayer Public Library

798 Washington Street (directly across from Town Hall, NB side)

Phone #[masked]

Website: thayerpubliclibrary.net or thayerpubliclibrary.org

Meeting Location: Please meet in Conference Room B on the 3rd Floor.  It's the last room on the left when you exit the stairs or elevator. 

Hosts/Organizers: Angela and Jodi

Min/Max: Minimum of 6 people 48 hours prior to the event.  Maximum of 15.

Guests: None. Members-Only preferred
Cost/Fees:  There are currently no costs or fees associated with this event.  If you want to make your annual voluntary contribution to Social Fun I will be happy to collect and mail it to Biagio.
RSVP Deadline: Monday, November 23rd @ 4pm 

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD

No-Show Policy:  People who RSVP "Yes" to events are expected to exercise common sense and common courtesy. That means making your best effort to keep any commitments that you make, but if necessary doing your best to notify the Event Organizer or (preferably, if it's the day of the event) the venue if something comes up after the RSVP deadline. If you find yourself unable to attend an event that you've RSVPed "Yes" to and you cannot either change your RSVP or let the venue know, please do contact the Event Organizer when you're able to, just to let us know that you're okay and that you're still interested in attending events.  Please be advised that any Assistant Organizer (AO) or the Group Organizer (GO) can remove a member from Social Fun who has 3 No-Shows in the past 3 months.  Additionally, Organizers may disallow members with 2 or more "No Show" marks from attending their events.  

***Please keep in mind that we are hosting this event in an effort to  involve members in the planning process, to get ideas and input directly from members, and to help encourage event hosting among members.***

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Parking: Free and ample parking on-site and across the street at Town Hall.

Directions/Location Overview:  Located directly across the street from Braintree town Hall less than 1/2 mile from Ext 17 on Route 3 and the Briantree T Station.

This is a weekly meeting where pregnant women and couples come to gain new insights about childbirth choices and issues that affect pregnancy and overall health.  Hear from birth experts ranging from midwives and doulas to registered nurses, educators and holistic healthcare practitioners. At every meeting you'll have a chance to join in discussions that will enlighten your pregnancy experience with both expert tips and the experiences of other pregnant women and their partners.  

Fun, informative and inviting, this group is the perfect place to have your questions answered about prenatal nutrition, chiropractic care during pregnancy, prenatal yoga, childbirth options, doula care, breastfeeding, baby registry, cloth diapering and so much more!  Please come on your own or with your partner to learn and share your thoughts and stories.  

For more information email Dr. Lizzie Sobel @ <a>[masked]</a>.

results.description:
This is our brand new auxiliary meetup event.  This is a great opportunity to socialize and play games in a relaxed environment -- and best of all, there's no cap on attendance.

We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, but the games at this particular event are going to be on the smaller side -- because those are often the games that work best in a cafe setting.

Our main meetup requires RSVPs due to heavy popularity and finite space.  This event runs simultaneously, two buildings away.  RSVPs are NOT required for this event.  RSVPs are still appreciated so the event hosts know how many people to expect, but you don't need to update them and can come even if you don't RSVP.

This event takes place once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 - 9:30 or 10.  Cosi closes at 10, but after 9:30, you are welcome to come and join the regular meetup at that point, no RSVP required.

Cosi Cafe has graciously allowed us to use their back seating area every week.  You are not required to buy anything from them, but their food is honestly pretty good, so please take advantage of them if you are hungry for dinner, soft drinks, or snacks.

We play whatever people bring, but you don't have to bring anything -- the hosts will always have a bag of games with them!  Some games that you might expect to see here include:

Red 7, Love Letter, Codenames, Pictomania, The Resistance, Avalon, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, Bang!, Glory to Rome, Innovation, Mottainai, Chrononaughts, Time Lines, Tash-Kalar

If you're looking for longer or larger Euros (like 7 Wonders, Puerto Rico, or Terra Mystica), check out our regular "Game Night" meetup.

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs up, then up again towards the busy street, which is Main Street.  Turn left and walk about 20 feet to Cosi.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it. 
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south. 
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) One side of the parking lot has a bunch of buildings with a handicapped ramp leading into it.  Go up the ramp, through the walkway, and Cosi will be right next to you when you come out.

results.description:
2 Player Games, ANY Game (Previously X-Wing Miniatures)

An opportunity to play those two player games that we do not play on a regular (mostly euro?) boardgaming night.  

If we have an odd number of players, or if we just feel like it, yes, it is fine doing a 3, 4 or 5 player game as well. 

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played? 


Anything.  Bring anything that you think will gather enough interest.  Examples: Netrunner, Marvel Dice Masters, Memoir '44, Twilight Struggle, Few Acres of Snow or even chess if that is your thing.  Put other suggestions on the event comments.

Will try this format a couple of times to see how it goes.

Q.  Should I bring something? 
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served, feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/beverages in the pizza cup.


Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm? 
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it? 
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q. What About X-Wing?

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Tuesday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

Interested in FREE Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas  ?? 

Vegan Cooking Classes or 
Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food 
(using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 

* What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag? 
* Portion Control 
* Bake...Don't Fry! 
* Roasted Veggie Stackers 
* No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream 
* Avocados!!! 
* Salad with Chipotle Hummus 
* Simple Cilantro Chutney 
* More $2 bags of Produce! 
* Drink your greens!

Question:

This sounds like a great deal, but is it meant for those in need, as is the case with food banks? 

Answer:

• For this operation, there are "No qualifications - no limits!" 

Thanks to the efficiency and BI (business intelligence) of Fair Foods of Dorchester (FairFoods.org), founded about 35 years ago by self-reported vegetarian Nancy Jamison, we have way more than AMPLE food for any intended audiences, and the operation is bettered if MORE people take the food than if FEWER take the food. 

Therefore, there is NO QUALIFICATION (no test of need) and no limit to how much you can cart off (just pay $2/bag). 

That's why it's posted on a meetup like this (not merely on a volunteer meetup). 

* There are tens of thousands of college students who could benefit by saving some money on their weekly produce purchases. 
* There are tens of thousands (myriads) of homemakers and working individuals who could benefit by saving some money on their weekly produce purchases. 
* Lots and lots of seniors AND needy folks, and there's no operational shame in prudent fiscal management if you know that you can get quality produce at a far lower price. 

[The snag is that, unlike in grocery stores - or even in Haymarket, your variety of produce is severely limited here because you're getting what Fair Foods sends to any specific site; you are unable to select from a broader arrangement of vegetables and a broader arrangement of fruits.  Typically, you get about 7-11 different items - about 5-8 different vegetables and 2-3 fruits, and you're often 'gifted' with extra items - 30 ounce jug of fresh hummus or lentil salad or chickpea salads, pound of garlic, large one-lb plastic container of ground pepper, or lots of other 'big items' we don't typically buy.] 

Make us busy - very busy.

results.description:
BVS Vegan Thanksgiving at Red Lentil 

* 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM Nov 23, 2015 - Monday 
* 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM Nov 24, 2015 - Tuesday 

The fabulous annual BVS Vegan Thanksgiving Dinner!

**RSVP required THROUGH BVS at this site.**

**Details, menu, and sign up are here.**

We hope that you can join us for a great meal and a good time!

**NO ONE GETS IN WITHOUT RESERVING WITH BVS.**

Red Lentil has created an exquisite menu at a bargain price for BVS!

Five courses, two items per course, plus vegetable sides and beverage all for just $25 (+tax+service.) 

Self-served buffet style so you can taste everything and go back for seconds on what you like best. 

The meal will be brimming with whole, unprocessed plant foods that combine beautiful colors, textures, and flavors, and bursts with nutritious, health-promoting ingredients. 

Red Lentil will offer their own Vegan Thanksgiving Dinner with a different menu on 

Thanksgiving Day

.  MONDAY & TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 23 & 24, 2015
4:30 - 9:30 PM - Open seating - Sign-up required 

We will be seated at friendly group tables, so never hesitate to arrive alone to a BVS event! 

If you are able to arrive at 4:30 PM or after 8:30, please do.

Peak time tends to be 6:30 - 8:00.

Parties of 5 or more, or those with small children, are recommended to arrive at 4:30 if possible. 

PRICE: $25 includes five-courses (both options for each) and beverage.
Tax and tip are extra.
Please be generous to the wait staff as they work very hard for our event! 

Children's prices: Up to 5 years FREE;
6-13 years 1/2 price ($12.50 + tax+service);
14-adult $25 (+tax+service) 

Vegan and organic wines are available as an extra. 

Please be mindful of food waste. Buffets are wonderful for tasting many items and getting seconds, but "the eye is bigger than the stomach" comes into play and can result in food waste. Please take only what you can eat.
results.name: BVS Vegan Thanksgiving at Red Lentil

Next meeting will be held on Tuesday, November 24 at 6 PM at the Senior Center Lounge at the Reading Senior Center.

As always donations are greatly appreciated to defray my meetup costs.

results.description:
CALLING ALL HEART PLAYERS!

                        Tonight we'll play HEARTS

        Bring your decks of cards and let the games begin!

Come join the C&C crew over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford for a night of HEARTS.  There is always conversation and dinner first but then we can split up and play a few tables of HEARTS.

Whether you prefer board games, card games or party games (or just want to meet people!), Tuesday nights will be your opportunity! We welcome  new additions to the group, and it's great to see new friendships being made over board games...

Although we start around 6:30pm or so, early birds can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.
results.name: HEARTS NIGHT  with  Good Friends and Food in Medford

results.description:
Spend some time on your project by bringing it along to our weekly project night, an evening designed around you and what you're working on.

This weekly event is about finding time to tinker, being creative, and meeting other members of the community.  You'll get the chance to see what others are working on, share your projects, and to get inspiration and feedback from fellow tinkerers.

On any given Tuesday night you have people working on electronics, knitting, writing code, wood-working, or just their plans for world domination. Beer is also consumed.

We’ll provide: space to work, basic tools, power, a room full of like minded people.

You’ll provide: your project, ideas and beer. A laptop would probably be useful too.

Sometimes we work on group projects together, which are usually set up as separate meetup events. Keep an eye on our events page to see what we’re working on next.

Find us: http://p.irateship.com/treasuremap.html
results.how_to_find_us: We are in the same building as Little India Market (next to Market Basket) - but at opposite end of the building. Door is left of the painted Pirateship mural.

Our location this week is Kresge 201 (remodeled classroom) in the most gracious and globally conscious Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, where health-conscious and energy-conscious building and curriculum modifications have been made.

Until further notice, we're in Kresge 201, at the top of the open stairwell near the guard's desk near the Countway Courtyard entrance to the Kresge Building.

下午6点到晚上8点3

PLEASE (try to) request by 4 pm the day before the Tuesday evening event.

* Harvard Square to LMA is about 30 minutes on #66 bus or M2 Harvard bus
* Green Line E-Line comes to Brigham Circle, then walk BACK to crosswalk, then to the building
* Walking from the Orange Line takes about 5-10 minutes, via Tremont Street to Brigham Circle
* Walking from Brookline is about 10 minutes - via Huntington Avenue or Longwood Avenue
* MFA, NEU, Wentworth, and Colleges of the Fenway are adjacent - on or off Huntington Avenue
* Route 9 comes right into the area, via Brookline - passes Huntington Avenue D-line stop
* Street parking is FREE from 6 pm onward (but not always easy to find)

Show your CURRENT LOCAL ID to the HSPH Security Guard on duty, then walk up the open indoor stairwell near the Kresge security guard, then straight up the stairwell, then turn left to Kresge 201 (follow signs to Kresge 201).

E-Mail [masked]
for a building pass if you don't have a Harvard ID; we convene in Kresge 201;
you may wish to ask the HSPH security guard how to access Kresge 201

results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

results.description:
Author Daphne Kalotay has graciously agreed to visit our meeting!

*****************************************

Lyrical and evocative, Sight Reading by Daphne Kalotay is an intense, literary love story.


When Hazel and Remy happen upon each other on a warm Boston spring day, their worlds immediately begin to spin. Remy, a gifted violinist, is married to composer Nicholas Elko, who was once the love of Hazel's life. Over the decades, each buried secrets, disappointments, and betrayals that now threaten to undermine their happiness.

We follow the notes of their complicated, intertwined lives from 1987 to 2007, from Europe to America, and from conservatory life to the Boston Symphony Orchestra.

Sight Reading, from the author of the acclaimed debut novel Russian Winter, is an exploration of what makes a family, of the importance of art in daily life, and of the role of intuition in both the creative process and the evolution of the self.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front of the cafe near the windows.
results.name: Sight Reading by Daphne Kalotay WITH AUTHOR VISIT

results.description:
Reserve your seat through General Assembly

About This Event
Machine learning, the art of teaching computers to learn and act on specific things without having to be programmed, is one of the most promising and most difficult to understand fields of the modern age. Come learn how to separate the signal from the noise with an industry veteran.

Takeaways 

• Understand how to vet a machine learning provider for legitimacy 

• Understand the difference between major areas of machine learning 

• Understand how to structure a problem to make it ready for a machine learning specialist 

• Understand why accuracy is a poor metric for most machine learning problems

About the Instructor
Slater Victoroff is the CEO of indico (www.indico.io). In previous lives Slater has been an MMA fighter, a buddhist monk, and a poet, though the last several years have been spent in solemn dedication to software. He is currently based in Boston.
results.name: Machine Learning for Non-Technical People

Let's climb at Central Rock Gym in Watertown! Meet by the cubbies/bench facing the rock wall (they will be on the right as you enter). I (JZ) am usually wearing green and have a blue harness and climbing shoes.  We usually climb for ~3 hrs and welcome all skill levels.  If you come late, come find us or ask the CRG staff for help.  They know we climb on Tuesdays and can help you find the group.

You will need to fill out the rock gym waivers and TAKE their Belay test, if you haven't already.

Day Passes
- $20 Adult*
- $16 Student/Military
* There are also punch-cards available to get 10 Day-Passes for the price of 9 visits

Gear Rental
- $8 Full Package
- $5 Harness
- $5 Shoes
- $2 Chalk
- $2 Belay Device

Membership options and further details are available on the website. You can also fill out a waiver online to save on paperwork when you arrive at the gym.

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.

The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed. All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.
