That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

results.name: Christian Meditation Practice

results.description: OK here is Polonius giving advice to his son Laertes ...in Hamlet. It will be the very last time he will see his son, and these are the very last words Laertes will hear from his father. Later, Laertes will try to avenge the death of his father Polonius by killing Hamlet, who accidentally kills Polonius. But these are timeless words, and lets consider them carefully, because they are still very relevant in the present. http://www.readwritethink.org/files/resources/lesson_images/lesson372/PoloniusExcerpt.pdf

results.name: Intellectual Snob Meetup

results.description:
I am tentatively (as in, it's possible that my plans might change) scheduling a Meetup for this Sunday at Pandemonium. The extra space and more generous time footprint of this event should allow us to play a game that there isn't usually time for on the regular Wednesday events.

I propose one of the following games that have been unplayed/uncompleted in my collection for a while:

* Triumph and Tragedy (3p)
* Indonesia (4-5p)
* 18AL (3-4p) -- or another short 18XX
* Republic of Rome (4-6p) -- yeah, we played this pretty recently but those who were there can tell you it wasn't much of a game after the manhandling the game hit us with.
* Struggle of Empires (5-7p) Last time we played, it went well, but we only got through the first two wars.

If you're interested in one of these games and you can make it this Sunday, please indicate preferences in the comments.
results.name: TURKEY COMA GAMING: Sunday Night, Pandemonium

results.description: Boston's Famous "2 DJ's, 2 Turntables, 1 Microphone" event is back at Ryles in Cambridge this Sunday! Vinyl DJ's Eddie Tunez and Rob Suave are digging deep into their collections and getting ready to throw down in an awesome night of music and dancing. Come hear some amazing musical gems guaranteed to inspire and thrill your dancing soul! Doors at 6pm, Intro Salsa and Bachata Lesson 6:30, The Social Dancing starts at 8pm! $10 .... plus don't miss the $5/plate Salsa Buffet. ...... We're gonna spin you round, right round!
results.name: Salsa Dancing at "Two DJ's, Two Turntables, One Microphone"

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

During the 1970s Lisa toured extensively with Bill Shute in Canada, England, and the U.S. They were known for their dynamic and innovative arrangements of ballads and other traditional folk songs. Lisa co-founded Green Linnet Records with Pat Sky but soon passed the company on to Wendy Newton. She now lives outside Washington DC and still performs locally. These days, she's working on an album of War of 1812 Songs with Peter Brice and Judy Cook. Lisa also appeared on the tribute album to Bruce Phillips, "Singing Through the Hard Times" (Righteous Babe Records) which was nominated for a Grammy. Lisa taught American Studies courses in folklore and music at Georgetown University during the 1990s.

results.description:
*To attend this event, you MUST RSVP on the Eventbrite page.*

Being clear and communicative during sexy times is a great way to make sure that everyone enjoys themselves and no one has a negative experience. But it can be hard to figure out exactly how to ask for what you want, and what the person you're with wants. So let's practice!

This event is part of Pleasure Pie's Experiential Growth Series. It’s about learning to communicate in sexual situations in a way that makes people feel comfortable and respected, through discussion and practice. :)

Here's how the evening will go:

Discussion

We'll start the evening with a thoughtful conversation about consent. What are some ways you can ask for consent without it being awkward? How can you say yes? How can you say no? How can you react when someone says no to you?

Kissing ice breakers

We'll transition into sexy time with some kissing games, like spin the bottle.

Make out time!

Next, we will have some time to practice what we've talked about with one another, respectfully. Everyone will be strongly encouraged (but not required!) to ask someone if they can kiss them. Everyone will also be strongly encouraged (almost required) to say no to someone at least once (if you want to say yes to everyone who asks you to kiss, you can say no to someone, and then ask them again in a minute).

Safer space

Pleasure Pie strives to create safer spaces. We will share what that means to each of us and come up with some guidelines during this event, but for now you can check out some guidelines we've used in the past here.

Donations

This event is sliding scale. You are welcome to attend for free, or donate $4 - $25. Any donations go to Pleasure Pie for organizing the event and The Democracy Center for hosting us. No judgment on whether or not you donate, and any donation you're comfortable giving is very appreciated!

Accessibility

This will be in the Rosa Parks room in The Democracy Center. It is private and cozy. Unfortunately, the building isn't wheelchair accessible. Please let me know if stairs are a hindrance to you.

RSVP

You must RSVP to attend this event! RSVP here.

When registering or checking in, please make sure to let us know you heard about the event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup. Thanks!


Cost

This event is sliding scale. You are welcome to attend for free, or to donate $4-$25. Donations go to Pleasure Pie for organizing the event, and the Democracy Center for hosting us.

***

FAQs

Is this for people of all genders?

Yes! This is for people of all genders, races, ages, etc. Feel free to invite people! RSVP is required.

Is it weird if I don't kiss anyone during this event?

You are not required to kiss people! If you're not feeling it, that's totally fine.

Will there be people having sex at this event?

Nope. This event is about kissing and being sensual with each other. If you're kissing someone, you are welcome to ask them if you can touch their body, but we are setting a few boundaries:

1. Don't take off or move anyone's clothes (including your own). Everyone should stay clothed enough to walk down the street.

2. Don't touch anyone's genital areas (even if it's through their clothes).

For the record, we have absolutely no problem with sex parties, but this event is not a sex party.
results.name: Consent is Sexy Make Out Party

results.description:
Racing Extinction: A Provocative New Environmental Documentary

Event link HERE. Film website HERE.

Free and open to the public. Pizza and beverages will be served. 

Monday, November 30th, 6pm


Malkin Penthouse, Littauer Bldg, 4th Floor, 79 JFK Street, Cambridge 

:: :: ::


A film screening and discussion at Harvard Kennedy School's Malkin Penthouse, Littauer Bldg, 4th Floor, 79 JFK Street, Cambridge, MA. This event is sponsored by the Belfer Center’s Environment and Natural Resources Program and the HKS Energy and Environment PIC. As climate negotiations begin in Paris, join us for a screening of a groundbreaking new documentary from Academy Award® Winning director Louie Psihoyos. Racing Extinction exposes the hidden forces driving many animal species toward extinction due to global climate change and illegal wildlife trafficking. With stunning photography under water and on land, this new documentary provides a global look at man’s devastating impact on endangered species. Screened at Sundance 2015, Racing Extinction will have its worldwide premiere in 220 countries and territories on the Discovery Channel on December 2, 2015. Accompanying the launch is a global action campaign #StartWith1Thing to encourage individuals, organizations and communities to make changes that will make a difference in terms of the environment and global climate change. Our Harvard audience has an advance opportunity to see and talk about the challenges raised by this provocative film.
results.name: Extinctions @ HKS

results.description:
At this event we will discuss the final two chapters of The Power of Now by Eckhart Tolle. 

A word of mouth phenomenon since its first publication, The Power of Now is one of those rare books with the power to create an experience in readers - one that can radically change their lives for the better. 

Eckhart Tolle is a contemporary spiritual teacher who is not aligned with any particular religion or tradition. He writes with the timeless and uncomplicated clarity of the ancient spiritual masters and imparts a simple yet profound message: There is a way out of suffering and into peace. He is the author of Stillness Speaks and Practicing the Power of Now. 

Join us on the journey


There is no charge for this event, however to use there room it is a requirement that EVERYONE that attends order food, I can't stress this enough, the restaurant is in business to make $$ and provide a service.  We are free to use their party room at no charge if we purchase food.  Please be respectful to this request. No perfumes please we have members with allergies.

results.description:
Learn how to communicate to bring your online dating into real world dating! Learn what to say to increase your chances of turning a "like" into a response and then, that message chatter into a real date.

Maybe you've been doing online dating for years. Maybe you’ve just recently decided to give online dating a try and yet you don’t know what to say or how to say it. You want to put yourself out there again, yet it feels so unnatural. Maybe you keep trying but you are still not getting many responses or they are just not turning into real life dates. What are you doing wring? 

How do you turn a "like" into a date? What are some things you can say in those fragile first communications that will get you that first date? You will learn what to say and how to say it to increase your chances of attracting and getting more actual dates.

Dating Coach Deborah Knight will answer these and many more questions concerning how to turn online dating to off-line, real life dating? How often do you write, text or call? When is the right time to send a message to someone, day or night? How much information do you share before meeting this person? Where do you agree to meet?

Dating Coach Deborah Knight will answer these and many more questions concerning how to turn online dating to off-line, real life dating? How often do you write, text or call? When is the right time to send a message to someone, day or night?  How much information do you share before meeting this person? Where do you agree to meet?

This is sure to be an informative evening as well as fun and interactive. Please bring your laptops, iPads, etc. so that you can formulate that first email to someone you have been thinking about. Put everything you learn into practice as you are learning it. 

Jon Fischer the host of the evening is a professional photographer who specializes in capturing the real and wonderful you for your online dating profile. Why not give your potential partner the opportunity to get a little glimpse of who you really are. Here's his website: GreatProfilePics.com 


The evening will take place in Jon's studio. A loft in an historic mill on Moody St in Waltham.  Here's a video peak at the studio, a perfect place to gather for a workshop like this.  Jon's Studio at open studios


Parking: Please click here:  Parking... Important

Starts at 6:30 -


Wine and cheese meet and greet afterwards.
results.name: What to say and how to say it to GET MORE DATES! with Online Dating

This is sure to be an informative evening as well as fun and interactive. Please bring your laptops, iPads, etc. so that you can formulate that first email to someone you have been thinking about. Put everything you learn into practice as you are learning it. 

Deborah is a Relationship and Law of Attraction Coach. Her life experience has been her biggest teacher, but she has combined that with her studies about Relationship, Positive Psychology, Neuroscience, Universal Laws, and 100’s of conversations with couples and individuals about their desire for relationship and what makes them fulfilling, and successful. Deborah is also a CTI Trained Life Coach and also an Intuitive Healer. She brings a dynamic combination of knowledge, insight, compassion, empathy, energy and her desire to be of service to whatever she does.

results.description:
Learn how to communicate to bring your online dating into real world dating! Learn what to say to increase your chances of turning a "like" into a response and then, that message chatter into a real date.

Maybe you've been doing online dating for years. Maybe you’ve just recently decided to give online dating a try and yet you don’t know what to say or how to say it. You want to put yourself out there again, yet it feels so unnatural. Maybe you keep trying but you are still not getting many responses or they are just not turning into real life dates. What are you doing wring? 

How do you turn a "like" into a date? What are some things you can say in those fragile first communications that will get you that first date? You will learn what to say and how to say it to increase your chances of attracting and getting more actual dates.

Dating Coach Deborah Knight will answer these and many more questions concerning how to turn online dating to off-line, real life dating? How often do you write, text or call? When is the right time to send a message to someone, day or night? How much information do you share before meeting this person? Where do you agree to meet?

This is sure to be an informative evening as well as fun and interactive. Please bring your laptops, iPads, etc. so that you can formulate that first email to someone you have been thinking about. Or how to respond next, once they are engaging with you to turn the pack and forth chatter into a real date. Put everything you learn into practice as you are learning it. 

Jon Fischer the host of the evening is a professional photographer who specializes in capturing the real and wonderful you for your online dating profile. Why not give your potential partner the opportunity to get a little glimpse of who you really are. Here's his website: SuccessfulOnlineDating.Photos

results.description:
This will be the third session of our new Current Events meetup series. We aim to have reoccurring discussions moving forward so we can stay abreast of local, national, and global anti-racism issues both as individuals and together as a community. We have seen a huge surge in media coverage within the racial justice movement over the past year. It can get overwhelming trying to keep up with all the stories, events, anniversaries, policies, and debates that touch on racial justice in some way. Let's pool our collective knowledge and discuss what's going on - locally, nationally, and globally - within the realm of anti-racism. This will be a great opportunity to share our sources, our stories, and our knowledge to keep everyone informed of the way things are changing, and unfortunately, the many ways in which things are staying the same.

The topics will change from month to month depending upon what's happening in the world, but many stories may carry over. Have a current event you'd like to discuss at the meeting that isn't listed below? Have a helpful article you'd like to share? Want to look at a story from an unexplored angle? Know of a local story/action/event that may not be getting coverage? Great! Feel free to post in the comments section below or email one of the facilitators with your ideas. We hope you'll come to this session willing to share a current event you've learned about over the past month or so. If not, feel free to come and listen, learn, and participate in some really important discussions. Looking forward to seeing you all there and kicking off this new series! 

Possible November Current Events:

- Beirut/Paris Terrorist Attacks 

- Campus Racism: Mizzou protests, football team, president resignation, Yale

- Spring Valley High School police brutality towards 16 year old black female student 

Review from October:


- Body Cameras coming to BPD & BPCAT policy

- Syrian Refugee Crisis
results.name: Current Events November

results.description:
Agenda 

6:30: Networking & Pizza

7:00 - 9:00: Presentations

Presentation 1: WordPress as a Non-Blogging WebApp Framework:

SchoolTwist is a new SAAS student registration service (and marketplace) to help PTAs offer after-school enrichment classes. WordPress multisite serves as our backend and I'll go over the challenges in using it for SchoolTwist, how I overcame those issues (hint: lots of custom plugins), and what I like to see from WordPress that would make it better suited for generic web-apps.
Format: Short Walk-through of SchoolTwist SAAS product, followed by challenges encountered, tools used, and plugins created. I would hope to field a good number of discussion points about the choices made and possible alternative approaches.


Bio:

JJ Rohrer is the indie developer behind School Twist - the after-school registration and class marketplace .  Prior to developing School Twist, JJ lived in Washington DC where he started Ascendly.  Ascendly teaches grade-school kids engineering through its after-school classes.  Ascendly is now in over 50 schools Washington  area schools.
He brings a broad engineering background from his US Air Force Academy training and his MS in Computer Systems. After the Air Force, JJ performed simulation and process consulting, as well as being involved in several start-ups and small businesses.  While part of a pilot Carnegie-Mellon acquisition auditing team, his team was specifically referenced by the Columbia Accident Investigation Board as a model for NASA to emulate. JJ has an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Presentation 2: Creating Customizable Widgets for Unpredictable Needs

Amanda Giles

Although your client may think they know what they want and where they want it – that’s bound to change. Learn how to develop your own customizable widgets so you can put the control into your client’s hands. In this session, we’ll review how to create your own widgets with options so that clients can add the features they want, change them, and move them around all on their own.


Bio

I’m proud to say that I make my living working with WordPress – largely as a theme developer. I also founded the Seacoast NH WordPress meetup group which currently holds 2 meetups each month (one aimed at Users and one at Developers). What else? I’ve a passion for roller coasters, a propensity to sneeze loudly and often, and a prime number fetish. Need to know more? Just ask. Learn more at www.amandagiles.com.
results.name: WP as a Non-Blogging WebApp Framework & Creating Customizable Widgets

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

Let's enjoy this documentary, Frame by Frame, (cosponsored by  UMass Boston and the DocYard) which follows photojournalists in Taliban-ruled Afghanistan. This event is the Boston premiere for this film.  Filmmakers questions and answers will follow screening. 


The film starts at 7pm, however I am setting the meeting time for this event for 6:30pm.  I would like gather as a group and then at 6:45pm, walk into the theater to get our seats. 


I plan to post a separate pre-gathering event at Cafe Algiers which is located next door to this theater.   So that we all connect, I strongly recommend that you come early and join at Cafe Algiers.


Admission is $11 ($9 for students and seniors)

Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. For events to be successful, I need to know who to expect and how many.  

This is a public event and you are certainly free to attend this event outside the Meetup group.  I just ask  that only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending this event and intend to meet members of the group.  

If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group.  

This is should be a fantastic event and look forward to seeing new and familiar faces.


Joana

***********************************************************************


ABOUT THE FILM

Synopsis: When the Taliban ruled Afghanistan, taking a photo was a crime. After the regime fell from power in 2001, a fledgling free press emerged and a photography revolution was born. Now, as foreign troops and media withdraw, Afghanistan is left to stand on its own, and so are its journalists. Set in a modern Afghanistan bursting with color and character, Frame by Frame follows four Afghan photojournalists as they navigate an emerging and dangerous media landscape—reframing Afghanistan for the world, and for themselves. Through cinema vérité, intimate interviews, powerful photojournalism, and never-before-seen archival footage shot in secret during the Taliban regime, the film connects audiences with four humans in the pursuit of the truth.

Bios:

When Alexandria Bombach and Mo Scarpelli first landed in Kabul in 2012, they were struck by the beauty, hope and complexity of a country that is often represented as war-torn and hopeless. With collective experience shooting non-fiction stories in more than 20 countries around the world, they teamed up to raise $75,000 for the film on Kickstarter, and then returned to Afghanistan in 2013 to find more in-depth perspective of Afghanistan through the eyes of local photojournalists.

https://www.umb.edu/filmseries/films/frame_by_frame

https://www.umb.edu/filmseries


*****************************************************************

About UMASS Film Series (https://www.umb.edu/filmseries/about)


The University of Massachusetts Boston Film Series is an initiative of the Chancellor's Office.


The UMass Boston Film Series pays particular attention to emerging and iconic directors of acclaimed documentaries that have obtained recognition for their unique, relevant, and exceptional cinematic efforts. The series hosts filmmakers for in-person Q&As moderated by curator and lecturer Chico Colvard. The Film Series also partners with UMass Boston faculty, film industry insiders, and local organizations to participate in post-screening panel discussions about the issues central to the featured films. Ultimately, the UMass Boston Film Series aims to create a synergy of place around the moving image.
results.name: Frame by Frame documentary film of Taliban-ruled Afghanistan - Boston Premiere

results.description:
The book for November is Nightingale, by Kristin Hannah

In love we find out who we want to be.

In war we find out who we are.

FRANCE, 1939

In the quiet village of Carriveau, Vianne Mauriac says goodbye to her husband, Antoine, as he heads for the Front. She doesn't believe that the Nazis will invade France...but invade they do, in droves of marching soldiers, in caravans of trucks and tanks, in planes that fill the skies and drop bombs upon the innocent. When a German captain requisitions Vianne's home, she and her daughter must live with the enemy or lose everything. Without food or money or hope, as danger escalates all around them, she is forced to make one impossible choice after another to keep her family alive.

Vianne's sister, Isabelle, is a rebellious eighteen-year-old girl, searching for purpose with all the reckless passion of youth. While thousands of Parisians march into the unknown terrors of war, she meets Gäetan, a partisan who believes the French can fight the Nazis from within France, and she falls in love as only the young can...completely. But when he betrays her, Isabelle joins the Resistance and never looks back, risking her life time and again to save others.

With courage, grace and powerful insight, bestselling author Kristin Hannah captures the epic panorama of WWII and illuminates an intimate part of history seldom seen: the women's war. The Nightingale tells the stories of two sisters, separated by years and experience, by ideals, passion and circumstance, each embarking on her own dangerous path ... more

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are Ladies' Night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Please RSVP if possible; helps everyone to know others are coming.  Meet at the picnic table near bouldering area (usually the round one, furthest from the cubbies, if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the Event Host(s) (see RSVP list), from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.

2 Player Games, ANY Game (Previously X-Wing Miniatures)

An opportunity to play those two player games that we do not play on a regular (mostly euro?) boardgaming night.  

If we have an odd number of players, or if we just feel like it, yes, it is fine doing a 3, 4 or 5 player game as well. 

Q & A:

Q.  What types of games are played? 


Anything.  Bring anything that you think will gather enough interest.  Examples: Netrunner, Marvel Dice Masters, Memoir '44, Twilight Struggle, Few Acres of Snow or even chess if that is your thing.  Put other suggestions on the event comments.

Will try this format a couple of times to see how it goes.

Q.  Should I bring something? 
A.  If you want, bring a game you feel comfortable teaching. There will be pizza and sodas served, feel free to bring snacks or beverages to share or chip in $5 to $10 for the pizza/beverages in the pizza cup.


Q.  Until when do you play games?  Can I arrive later than 7pm? 
A.  Until the last game of the evening ends, usually past midnight.  Yes, you can arrive later than 7pm, but you may have to wait for a new game to start if you do.

Q.  I really want to play XYZ game, can we schedule it? 
A.  Some people ask for interest in a particular game on the event comments below.  This may be the way to make sure you get to play the game you want. 

Q. What About X-Wing?
A. If you noticed, this spot is filling up the time previously scheduled for X-Wing Miniatures 100pts - so... as you may have guessed, Randy and I will be setting up a couple of x-wing miniatures tables for those of us inclined towards that game but still want to make the event more inclusive to other game genres (it is not often the wife allows me to invite my friends to play games, so I better make the best use of the time).

results.description:
This year has just flown by! The holidays are coming whether we are ready or not.  Remember last year, swearing it would be your last year as a single person and you’d have someone to share the next holiday season.  How many years have you said the same thing.  Here comes another Christmas, or New Year’s Eve or Valentine’s Day single, to see friends that are in relationships, feeling like the 3rd, 4th or 5th wheel, never having that love you so desire.  When February 15th rolls around the pressure eases up a bit and again you swear next year will be different. You will have someone by the next holiday season.  And here we are.

What have you accomplished this year with love?  Are you in the same place as last year? Has anything changed?  Are you ready for a change? Now is the time to get the ball rolling. 


Come join me as we discover what is really holding you back from finding love this holiday season.  Let’s see what we can create!


I'll also be announcing my new challenge "Break the Single habit". 


Please bring a notepad and pen to take notes. 

Please order something from the menu to support JJ Grimsby's for having us again.

This month we will be reading The Forever War by Joe Haldeman. 

 From Goodreads, "The Earth's leaders have drawn a line in the interstellar sand—despite the fact that the fierce alien enemy that they would oppose is inscrutable, unconquerable, and very far away. A reluctant conscript drafted into an elite Military unit, Private William Mandella has been propelled through space and time to fight in the distant thousand-year conflict; to perform his duties without rancor and even rise up through military ranks. Pvt. Mandella is willing to do whatever it takes to survive the ordeal and return home. But "home" may be even more terrifying than battle, because, thanks to the time dilation caused by space travel, Mandella is aging months while the Earth he left behind is aging centuries."

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

results.description:
In his book “The Singularity Is Near”, futurist Ray Kurzweil says that technology will soon solve our greatest energy, education, health and climate challenges.

But the skeptics fear that once our machines become literally millions or trillions of times smarter than we are, there is no reason to think they’ll view us any differently than we view ants or pets.

The military is already commissioning ‘killer robots’ with autonomous power to use lethal force without human intervention.

In this C-Span video (different from the one below), documentarian James Barrat talks about his book, Our Final Invention: Artificial Intelligence and the End of the Human Era, in which he explores the threat of runaway Artificial Intelligence. He argues that we are headed into a future in which machines will be able to outthink humans. He says that many people in the Artificial Intelligence community acknowledge the threat but have largely ignored it so far, but Bill Gates, Stephen Hawking and Tesla founder Elon Musk all say that Artificial Intelligence has the potential to be as dangerous to mankind as nuclear weapons.

https://youtu.be/WQ6yGkUNjqM

Come and share your thoughts on this topic.
results.name: Could Artificial Intelligence End Human Civilization?

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
